rev.diff:
Line 150: Line 150:
Gabest, original author of [[Media Player Classic]] claimed that KMP was violating the [[GNU General Public License | GNU General Public License (GPL)]] by using GPLed code written by both him and others in a closed-source program. The development team has denied this allegation; they maintain that player did not actually include the mentioned GPL code in the executable, and thus was not breaking any GPL rules.<ref>[http://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?thread_id=1387859&forum_id=462894 GPL violation post] in SourceForge, posted 23 Apr 2005 by Gabest.</ref><ref>[http://www.kmplayer.com/forums/showthread.php?t=141 Do not believe bad rumors spread in networks.] in KMP Forum, posted 19 Nov 2005 by Z.</ref> Controversially, player was bundled with a GPL component, although when the authors were notified they deleted the GPL breaching part bundled with the program.<ref>[http://www.kmplayer.com/forums/showthread.php?p=481#post481 RadGTSplitter.ax being removed from the player bundle, including the GPL license.]</ref>
Gabest, original author of [[Media Player Classic]] claimed that KMP was violating the [[GNU General Public License | GNU General Public License (GPL)]] by using GPLed code written by both him and others in a closed-source program. The development team has denied this allegation; they maintain that player did not actually include the mentioned GPL code in the executable, and thus was not breaking any GPL rules.<ref>[http://sourceforge.net/forum/forum.php?thread_id=1387859&forum_id=462894 GPL violation post] in SourceForge, posted 23 Apr 2005 by Gabest.</ref><ref>[http://www.kmplayer.com/forums/showthread.php?t=141 Do not believe bad rumors spread in networks.] in KMP Forum, posted 19 Nov 2005 by Z.</ref> Controversially, player was bundled with a GPL component, although when the authors were notified they deleted the GPL breaching part bundled with the program.<ref>[http://www.kmplayer.com/forums/showthread.php?p=481#post481 RadGTSplitter.ax being removed from the player bundle, including the GPL license.]</ref>
K-Multimedia Player is listed on [[FFmpeg]]'s Hall of Shame indicating that it is violating FFmpeg's license terms by distributing binaries of software under GPL or [[LGPL]] without source.<ref>[http://ffmpeg.mplayerhq.hu/shame.html FFmpeg Hall of Shame]</ref>
K-Multimedia Player is listed on [[FFmpeg]]'s Hall of Shame indicating that it is violating FFmpeg's license terms by distributing binaries of software under GPL or [[LGPL]] without source.<ref>[http://ffmpeg.mplayerhq.hu/shame.html FFmpeg Hall of Shame]</ref>
  +   +
==Reception==
  +
KMPlayer has been listed has one of the five best multimedia players by [[LifeHacker]].<ref>http://lifehacker.com/5333275/five-best-video-players</ref>
